results.title: Where there's a will...
results.creator_credit: Victorian Society for Crippled Children and Adults and Cine-Service
results.brief_description: The work of the Victorian Society for Crippled Children and Adults in helping the physically handicapped to learn full, happy and as far as possible, independent lives. The Society tries to reach handicapped children early, so that they may benefit from training and companionship in special play centres. Special schools and holiday camps are organised for older children, while Deva Hostel and its annexe provide a home for handicapped young adults from the country, enabling them to further their education and compete for employment. More severely handicapped people are able to work at the Society’s Craft Centre at Albert Park.

results.title: Where the Desert Meets the Sea
results.credit_line:
Cinematography by Brad Gibb 
Edited by Ben Lane  
Special thanks to Wayne Miller
results.material_description: Single-channel video, HDMI 4k video projection, 16:9, colour, sound, 4:12 min
results.brief_description: Shelley Ware’s film Where the Desert Meets the Sea (2020) tells the story of her family’s legacy that has led her to a career in AFL presenting.
results.description:
Shelley Ware is one of Australia’s most respected female sports presenters. She is a Yankunytjatjara, Wirangu and Kokatha woman, well known for her role on the SBS program Marngrook Footy Show. Currently, Ware hosts the AFL.com web show ‘Colour of Your Jumper’. Ware is also an educator, and her film Where the Desert Meets the Sea tells the story of her family’s legacy that has led her to a career in AFL presenting.

“This is a story of my Country and why the game of AFL and the Koonibba Football Club are so important to me. I share the stories of my people, as a teacher and sports presenter, so that our children, can be what they see.” – Shelley Ware
description_for_label:

results.title: Where small wings fly
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of the Queensland Bush Pilot Airways, the type of aircraft used, the base for operations, the services provided by the company, and the advantages of using the Bush Airways.
results.description: Describes the establishment of the Queensland Bush Pilot Airways, the type of aircraft used, the base for operations, the services provided by the company, and the advantages of using the Bush Airways.

results.title: Where did you get that woman?
results.brief_description: A delightful documentary look at the life of a 70-year-old African American women who earns a small income from a job as a night-time toilet attendant at a wealthy hotel in an area frequented by the “beautiful people”. The film contrasts her life here on the richer side of town with her more mundane existence in ahousing estate for senior citizens and, as well, provides an account of her life from childhood through the use of stills and her own colorful commentary. The film touches on many issues: the Depression era in America, poverty, race relations, city and rural life, old age, loneliness, popular music and family life. Featuring Joan Williams.

results.title: When the day breaks
results.brief_description: A chicken man and a pig woman bump into each other setting off a chain of events. 2001 Annecy Winner. One of the most affecting animated films of recent times. A story that highlights the things that connect us.

results.title: When in pain
results.creator_credit: Jerome Karasic, Claire Menken and Shepard Menken
results.brief_description: Analyses aspects of physical and emotional pain, and examines the brain’s never-ending battle with the pain of anxiety, of alleviating pain and removing the source of pain.

results.title: When I am rich
results.creator_credit: Derek Phillips Animation and New Fields
results.brief_description: Our hero dreams of winning a lot of money, buying new clothes and a car, then having a grand party. Short animated satire on the desire for personal wealth. The moral of the film is that the idea of suddenly gaining personal wealth is very attractive, including the delusion that it will bestow power and influence. However, desires are only dreams: it is more realistic to build one’s happiness on one’s true situation.

results.title: When gold is green
results.brief_description: Gives a detailed picture of the care associated with tobacco growing in Ontario. Harvested by hand, typed, cured and baled by grade, the crop is marketed, and then stored for 1-3 years before being blended, cut and dehumidified during the highly mechanized process of cigarette manufacture.

results.title: Wheat today what tomorrow?
results.brief_description: David Bellamy takes us on an entertaining, challenging tour of what we had always assumed were productive farmlands. As caretaker of this planet, he suggests that we restore the barren farming lands to a green and lively landscape.
